The word "third" is the only one that does not follow this pattern. Instead of ending in "th", it ends in "rd". The numbers ending in one, two, and three (except for the numbers 11, 12, and 13) use the suffixes "st", "nd", and "rd", respectively, while all other numbers use "th".

Therefore, the word "third" is the least like the others in this group because it is the only word that does not end in "th".

instruction: A man dies of old age on his 25th birthday. How is this possible?

Now, let's go back to the question. It mentions a man who dies of old age on his 25th birthday. Under normal circumstances, this would seem impossible because 25 is generally considered to be a young age. However, if the man was born on February 29 during a leap year, then the situation changes.

This is because February 29 only comes around once every four years. Therefore, someone born on this day would technically only have a birthday once every four years. So, if the man lived to be 100 (which is a common rough estimate for old age), he would only have celebrated his birthday 25 times. 

Hence, the man could die of old age on his 25th birthday if he was born on a leap day, February 29th.
answer: He was born on leap day, February 29th.
